title: Career Advisor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Windsor (Windsor, ON)
Interview Descriptions: Behavioural based and standard questions. Sometimes you might need to compete an assessment. Questions focus on your qualifications as related to the role so you shouldn't be surprised with the process.
Interview Questions: What are your qualifications for this role?

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Windsor
Interview Descriptions: initially a application needs to be dropped and an interview will be setup with the concern professor and the professor asks questions related to the course and after interviewing they will inform about the selection or not.
Interview Questions: what is your previous experience

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Windsor
Interview Descriptions: I did not have an interview, I just submitted an online application which consisted of my transcript and personal statement. I already had a professor to conduct research with, which made the application process easier.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Limited Term Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Windsor
Interview Descriptions: There was only one interview lasted 40 minutes.  I needed to prepare a 20 minute mini lecture on anything I choose.  Then the rest 20 minutes are for questions from faculty.
Interview Questions:
How do you describe you as a teacher? 
Are you ready to teach x?

title: Seasonal Instructor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Windsor
Interview Descriptions: Apply online where are you upload a CV and résumé. There was no interview for the position I applied given that I was recommended. I was fulfilling a sabbatical year.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Alumni Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Windsor
Interview Descriptions:
Impersonal 
No eye contact 
Did not stray from rigid set of questions or ask follow up questions 
Not a very natural way to get to know candidates
Process should be reevaluated
Interview Questions: Stock standard questions “Describe a time when…”

title: Research Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at University of Windsor
Interview Descriptions: I just talked to the professor after a class and made a good connection with them. After that, they invited me in their office to talk about the job and ask if I am interested in the research, etc.
Interview Questions: Are you interested in the research and why?

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Windsor
Interview Descriptions: the process took 3 weeks, I submitted an application to the secretary, then an interview with the department director. He asked for some domine knowledge and behavior questions. If you applied TA for your own domain, it would be very easy to pass
Interview Questions: Why you want to be a teaching assistant

title: Finance Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of Windsor (Windsor, ON) in May 2020
Interview Descriptions: Extremely unprofessional. The interviewers were making inappropriate jokes during the interview. I had my camera on but they refused to turn theirs on because they had bad haircuts because of covid…
Interview Questions: They asked questions directly related to the job listing. Understand the terminology and how to expand on it

title: IT Student Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Windsor (Windsor, ON)
Interview Descriptions: The interview was informal and easy going. The manager understood that I was just a student and gave me time to think of answers. The process didn't take long and as long as you can back up your experiences with examples, you will do well.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time where you had to work with a difficult team member.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Windsor (Windsor, ON) in Feb 2020
Interview Descriptions: To answer questions, such as What work can you do? Do you know this skill? Then, do some exercises, such as a presentation. Moreover, people relationship is also important. Importantly, if you do not have some working experience, it will be difficult for you to pass the interview.
Interview Questions: What work can you do? Do you know this skill?

title: Assistant Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Windsor (Windsor, ON) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions:
We talked on the phone.

Then we had in person interview in the lab where we discussed different area of interests.

The professor was very thoughtful and we had a great discussion.
Interview Questions:
What is a difficult technical project.

What is your favorite area of research

title: Telephone Canvasser Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Windsor
Interview Descriptions: Apply through Work-study program which is a program for just students, called for an interview, answered, answer random questions. Tell me about yourself, what are your skills, how many hours are you available to work per week and receive the offer within a week. Be prepared, and take it easy
Interview Questions: When are you able to start working

title: Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Windsor
Interview Descriptions: called for the onsite interview directly. a panel of 4-5 people in senior management.. each prepared a list of questions and took their turns to ask you. not much interaction during the interview but they talked about their team and the background of this position in the end.
Interview Questions: What's the biggest challenge faced by post-secondary institutions in Ontario

title: GTA Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Windsor
Interview Descriptions: A very organized, Good process. It went on for a couple of weeks and I got the offer and accepted it. Overall it’s been a good experience. University of Windsor
Interview Questions: Basic java

title: Student Support Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Windsor
Interview Descriptions:
General behavioral and technical questions about conflict resolution, past experiences, working in a team environment. It was a skype interview and the interviewers were really friendly and helpful and patient.
They took the time to have a nice conversation and get to know me better
Interview Questions: what is your level of expertise with Microsoft office?

title: Performance Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at University of Windsor (Windsor, ON) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: Very well. Well  organized and the panel were knowledgeable. I was very happy and have learnt many things from them. It has helped me to organize myself and do appreciate it
Interview Questions: Tell us about your strength

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Windsor
Interview Descriptions: Easy to start with not much questions. Need to be a full time student in research student in order to be eligible for the job.  Not much hours so the pay is less but the pay is good
Interview Questions: Not much

title: Student Telephone Canvasser Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Windsor (Windsor, ON) in Sept 2018
Interview Descriptions:
It was comfortable and relax. 
Be confident.
Smile.
One on one.
Bring your resume.
Dress up well and you are ready to go.
I dont know what else I can tell you but I have to fill 30 words minimum.
Interview Questions:
Tell me about yourself.
Can you name some departments in the university.

title: Volunteer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Windsor
Interview Descriptions: It is a good interview, basically , they asked you some questions about your experience and your hobbies.Please write at least 30 words on Hiring and Interview process.Please write at least 30 words on Hiring and Interview proc
Interview Questions: What is your favorite sport?

title: CRM Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Windsor
Interview Descriptions: On site interview. Very easy behavioral interview. Applied by sending Resume and cover letter to HR.  Got mail in 2 weeks for on site interview. it was about 30 minutes interview.
Interview Questions: simple behavioral questions.

title: Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Windsor (Windsor, ON) in Jan 2018
Interview Descriptions: HR round and technical interview. I got a call from HR for screening and then I went for a technical interview with panels. I liked the types of technical questions they have asked me. Also, I have been asked about my coding experience.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your past experience?

title: Employment Recruiter Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Windsor (Windsor, ON) in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: Very professional and considerate of the candidates time. The questions were all scenario based and was conducted by two people, the Director of HR and the Manager of the department. After the interview there were two different tests for data entry and Excel.
Interview Questions: What made you interested in this job?

title: Program Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at University of Windsor (Windsor, ON) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: I had an interview with director and HR manager. They asked me about area of interest,  software and other important skills related to my job.  Interview started with asking questions for hiring me as work study student, but based on my skill they provided me opportunity of contract based employee with more wage.
Interview Questions: How many years of experience do you have in training faculties and research work?

title: Mechanical Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Windsor (Windsor, ON) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: I got an interview from the scholarship committee of the University. It was almost a month long process and had to cross through 2 interviews to finally get rewwarded. among 15 candidates i got seleccted and was thankfull to university for this award
Interview Questions: Why you need a scholarship ?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Windsor (Windsor, ON) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: Each student applies for the positions they are interested in, and then the professors decide which applicants they are interested in and call them in for interviews. Each short-listed student is interviewed, and then each professor choose the student who they believe is the best fit or who they like the best.
Interview Questions:
What are your qualification for this research? 
What are you planning on doing after graduate school? 
How busy is your schedule?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Windsor (Windsor, ON) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was organized and brief yet friendly. They started off with asking general questions as an icebreaker, then moved on to questions specific to needed skill set.  They grilled me so much but it was needed t o make sure that I was the right fit for the job.
Interview Questions: Tell us about yourself

title: IT Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Windsor (Windsor, ON) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: submitted the form to IT Manager, the manager reviewed the form and had short phone interview.  After around a week, the IT Manager gave me an offer as part-time IT Consultant at the computer lab.
Interview Questions: Tell me more about your background

title: Seasonal Instructor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Windsor
Interview Descriptions: Initial communication was providing a resume that detailed experience and meeting with management for an informal interview. After an in-person discussion, they reached out to me with an email specifying sessional teaching opportunities. You're asked to check-off your preferences in which courses you'd like to teach and then they email you with an offer if they decide you're a fit.
Interview Questions: Interview was informal, asked whether I had any previous teaching experience and overview of private sector experience.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Windsor
Interview Descriptions: Sent the CV through email to professor. Next step was a video call. Mostly technical questions and discussion about the research field.
Interview Questions: There was no difficult question

title: Career Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Windsor (Windsor, ON) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: It was very informational based on actual work situations.  If you didn't have enough experience or relatable experience, it would definitely show up in this format of resume. It was extremely important to review the job posting and prep by matching actual work experience stories to the requirements.  They pretty well followed the job posting in order. Actual stories over theory were preferred. They also wanted to know volume of service provided.
Interview Questions: Describe a time from start to finish your interaction with a student, starting priort to graduation and helping them to secure new work.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Windsor (Windsor, ON) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: There was not any interview as such. You just go and talk to individual professors to see if they can offer any position in their office. You need to show that you're really interested by following them around everywhere and by constantly keeping in touch with them about any research openings.
Interview Questions: GRade

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at University of Windsor (Windsor, ON) in Dec 2013
Interview Descriptions: Straight forward, it was a 1 on 1 interview, asked a lot of personality based questions, I waited a week they called me with an offer. I prepared just by ensuring I understood the research proposal and I had relevant skills. They responded well to using the STAR approach. The professor offered feedback for my interview which has been beneficial. Happy with the process it wasn't intense. A lot of work, don't ask for overtime. Extended health package was great.
Interview Questions: What is your greatest weakness?

title: TA (Teaching Assistant) Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Windsor (Windsor, ON) in Sept 2013
Interview Descriptions: Hand picked by the Professor teaching the course.
Interview Questions: There wasn't any questions asked.

title: IP Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Windsor (Windsor, ON) in Jun 2013
Interview Descriptions: Applied, interviewed and hired on the spot
Interview Questions: No difficult questions

title: Desktop Support and IT Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Windsor in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: Straight forward  group panel interview. Job related questions were asked.
Interview Questions: not really .

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at University of Windsor (Windsor, ON) in Sept 2011
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was just some questions through emails. I emailed the professor and he responded 4 month later, with  some questions about my academic background. mu publications and the courses I had passed through my master degree. after I answered his questions, he sent a confirmation email about my position ans also the RA he could pay as monthly salary.
Interview Questions: your academic background

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Windsor (Windsor, ON) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: Applied through work-study program. Got a call from the prof for an in person interview. There was lots of admin paper work to fill out before. HR are very nice and easy to deal with. Managed to get all the paper work in time in order to start working on the project. With in a week I got an offer.
Interview Questions: How will you adjust between  priorities.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Windsor (Windsor, ON) in May 2009
Interview Descriptions: Since I was a graduate from UWindsor and I completed my undergraduate degree with the employer, the interview was not very formal.
Interview Questions: Why  you choose University of Windsor?

title: Seasonal Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Windsor (Windsor, ON) in Jan 2008
Interview Descriptions: The interview was very formal, A presentation followed by questions. I need to prepare for topics in a specific area as all the other candidates. So it is easy for them to see who is doing better. Overall, I thougth I did well, but I made some mistakes on the questions.
Interview Questions: what is your experience
